page.title: 03AYMESTREY CHURCH
page.content: The church is dedicated to{St.John {the Baptist and St.Alkmund}and covers both Amestrey and Leinthall Earles parishes. It shares a vicar with 3 other parishes and has 3 services a month with an average attendance of 15. The church is run by a Parochial Church Council of 15 who, with many helpers from the Parish, organise Flower Festivals, Harvest,Christmas and Easter Festivals and bazaars to raise the money for upkeep and to pay dues to{Leominster Deanery Synod}(Â£881 in 1985) and Rector's expenses of Â£230. The building is of{Norman}foundation with additions through the centuries. It is made of local sandstone and limestone with a tower with clock and 6 bells. One of its greatest treasures is a handsome 16th century{ROOD SCREEN the finest in the county.
